description: From em- +‎ bold +‎ -en. Compare Middle English embold, inboldyssh.

verbs.description: embolden (third-person singular simple present emboldens, present participle emboldening, simple past and past participle emboldened)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To render (someone) bolder or more courageous.
examples: The author lamented that the power of techniques involving instrumental variables and natural experiments to uncover causal relationships had emboldened economists to venture into areas far from their traditional expertise [...].

entries.meaning: (transitive, typography) To format text in boldface.
